events.originalText: Hurricane Dorian, the most powerful Atlantic hurricane on record outside the tropics, made landfall in the Bahamas at Category 5 intensity.
events.subtitle: Hurricane Dorian
events.headline: Hurricane Dorian Makes Landfall in the Bahamas at Category 5 Intensity

events.originalText: Speakers' Corner, a free speech area in Hong Lim Park in Singapore, was launched.
events.subtitle: Speakers' Corner, Singapore
events.headline: Speakers' Corner Launched in Hong Lim Park, Singapore

events.originalText: A Soviet jet interceptor shot down the civilian Korean Air Lines Flight 007 near the island of Sakhalin in the north Pacific, killing all 246 passengers and 23 crew on board.
events.subtitle: Interceptor aircraft
events.headline: Soviet Jet Interceptor Shoots Down Korean Air Lines Flight 007, Killing All On Board

events.originalText: A 76-hour multinational rescue effort in the Irish Sea resulted in the deepest sub rescue in history (pictured).
events.subtitle: Irish Sea
events.headline: Multinational Rescue Effort in Irish Sea Results in Deepest Sub Rescue in History

events.originalText: In a match widely publicized as a Cold War confrontation, American chess grandmaster Bobby Fischer became the 11th World Chess Champion with his victory over Soviet Boris Spassky.
events.subtitle: Cold War
events.headline: Bobby Fischer Becomes World Chess Champion in Cold War Match

events.originalText: Muammar Gaddafi (pictured) led a coup d'état to overthrow King Idris of Libya.
events.subtitle: Muammar Gaddafi
events.headline: Muammar Gaddafi Leads Coup to Overthrow King Idris of Libya

events.originalText: At an Arab League summit, eight nations issued the Khartoum Resolution, declaring that there would be "no peace with Israel, no recognition of Israel, [and] no negotiations with it".
events.subtitle: 1967 Arab League summit
events.headline: Arab League Summit Issues Khartoum Resolution Against Israel

events.originalText: Rioting erupted in Dayton, Ohio, resulting in one death and the mobilization of the Ohio National Guard.
events.subtitle: 1966 Dayton race riot
events.headline: Rioting Erupts in Dayton, Ohio Resulting in One Death

events.originalText: Ernest Hemingway's novel The Old Man and the Sea, which later won the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction, was first published.
events.subtitle: Ernest Hemingway
events.headline: Ernest Hemingway's The Old Man and the Sea First Published

events.originalText: German forces attacked multiple locations in Poland, including Wieluń and Westerplatte, starting World War II in Europe.
events.subtitle: Invasion of Poland
events.headline: German Forces Attack Poland, Starting World War II in Europe

events.originalText: The first group of around 172,000 Koreans were deported by Soviet authorities from the Russian Far East to the Kazakh and Uzbek SSRs; around 10 to 25 percent died.
events.subtitle: Koryo-saram
events.headline: Soviet Authorities Deport Koreans to Kazakh and Uzbek SSRs

events.originalText: The passenger pigeon, which once numbered in the billions, became extinct when the last individual died in captivity
events.subtitle: Passenger pigeon
events.headline: Passenger Pigeon Becomes Extinct as Last Individual Dies

events.originalText: Construction began on the Saline Valley salt tram, which during its operation was the steepest tram in the United States.
events.subtitle: Saline Valley salt tram
events.headline: Construction Begins on Saline Valley Salt Tram in the United States

events.originalText: The first science fiction film, titled A Trip to the Moon and based on From the Earth to the Moon by Jules Verne, was released in France.
events.subtitle: Science fiction film
events.headline: First Science Fiction Film A Trip to the Moon Released in France

events.originalText: A small British force commanded by a surgeon fought off a surprise attack by the Maya on Orange Walk Town, British Honduras.
events.subtitle: Battle of Orange Walk
events.headline: British Force Fights Off Maya Attack in British Honduras

events.originalText: American Civil War: Confederate forces attacked retreating troops of the Union Army during a rainstorm in Chantilly, Virginia, but the battle ended inconclusively.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Confederate Forces Attack Union Army Troops in Chantilly, Virginia

events.originalText: A powerful solar flare caused a coronal mass ejection that struck Earth a few hours later, generating the most intense geomagnetic storm ever recorded and causing bright aurorae visible in the middle latitudes.
events.subtitle: Carrington Event
events.headline: Powerful Solar Flare Causes Intense Geomagnetic Storm on Earth

events.originalText: A powerful solar flare caused a coronal mass ejection that struck Earth a few hours later, generating the most intense geomagnetic storm ever recorded and causing bright aurorae visible in the middle latitudes.
events.subtitle: Carrington Event
events.headline: Powerful Solar Flare Causes Intense Geomagnetic Storm on Earth

events.originalText: German astronomer Karl Ludwig Harding discovered one of the largest main-belt asteroids, naming it Juno after the Roman goddess.
events.subtitle: Karl Ludwig Harding
events.headline: Astronomer Karl Ludwig Harding Discovers Asteroid Juno

events.originalText: Under orders from Governor Thomas Gage, British soldiers removed gunpowder from a magazine in the Province of Massachusetts Bay, which caused Patriots to prepare for war.
events.subtitle: Thomas Gage
events.headline: British Soldiers Remove Gunpowder in Massachusetts Bay, Patriots Prepare for War

events.originalText: The Guru Granth Sahib (folio depicted), the religious text of Sikhism, was installed in the Golden Temple in Amritsar.
events.subtitle: Guru Granth Sahib
events.headline: Guru Granth Sahib Installed in Golden Temple in Amritsar

events.originalText: The main altar of Lund Cathedral, then the Catholic cathedral of all the Nordic countries, was dedicated to Saint Lawrence and the Virgin Mary.
events.subtitle: Lund Cathedral
events.headline: Main Altar of Lund Cathedral Dedicated to Saint Lawrence and the Virgin Mary
